translated: Points of Controversy
The Great Fifty
The twelfth section
Discussion of one who has at most seven rebirths

analyzed: satta kkhattu paramaḥ puggalaḥ satta kkhattu parama tā niyato ti
translated: Is a person who has at most seven rebirths determined as having at most seven rebirths?
Yes.🔽Has he killed his mother …🔽his father …
an awakened one …

original: arahā jīvitā voropito …🔽duṭṭhena cittena tathāgatassa lohitaṁ uppāditaṁ …
analyzed: arahā jīvitā voropitaḥ  duṭṭhena cittena tathāgatassa lohitam uppāditam
translated: caused the blood of an awakened one to flow …
split the Saṅgha?
You shouldn’t say that.

analyzed: satta kkhattu paramaḥ puggalaḥ satta kkhattu parama tā niyato ti
translated: Is a person who has at most seven rebirths determined as having at most seven rebirths?
Yes.
Is it impossible for him to realize the deathless in between?
You shouldn’t say that.
Is it impossible for him to realize the deathless in between?
Yes.🔽Has he killed his mother …🔽his father …
an awakened one …

original: arahā jīvitā voropito …🔽duṭṭhena cittena tathāgatassa lohitaṁ uppāditaṁ …
analyzed: arahā jīvitā voropitaḥ  duṭṭhena cittena tathāgatassa lohitam uppāditam
translated: caused the blood of an awakened one to flow …
split the Saṅgha?
You shouldn’t say that.

analyzed: satta kkhattu paramaḥ puggalaḥ satta kkhattu parama tā niyato ti
translated: Is a person who has at most seven rebirths determined as having at most seven rebirths?
Yes.

original: Atthi so niyamo yena niyamena sattakkhattuparamo puggalo sattakkhattuparamatāniyatoti?
analyzed: atthi saḥ niyamaḥ yena niyamena satta kkhattu paramaḥ puggalo satta kkhattu parama tā niyato ti
translated: Is there a rule according to which the person who has reached the limit of seven times is limited to seven times?”

analyzed: na ha ivam vattabbe pe  atthi te satipaṭṭhānā pe
translated: “No.”🔽“Are there the four establishments of mindfulness …
the four right efforts …
the four foundations for supernormal power …🔽the five spiritual faculties …
the five spiritual powers …

original: bojjhaṅgā yehi bojjhaṅgehi sattakkhattuparamo puggalo sattakkhattuparamatāniyatoti?
analyzed: bojjhaṅgāḥ yehi bojjhaṅgehi satta kkhattu paramaḥ puggalaḥ satta kkhattu parama tā niyato ti
translated: the seven factors of awakening according to which the person who has reached the limit of seven times is limited to seven times?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye faculty and the eye consciousness?” …

original: Natthi so niyamo yena niyamena sattakkhattuparamo puggalo sattakkhattuparamatāniyatoti?
analyzed: natthi saḥ niyamaḥ yena niyamena satta kkhattu paramaḥ puggalo satta kkhattu parama tā niyato ti
translated: “Is there no rule according to which the person who has reached the limit of seven times is limited to seven times?”
“Yes.”

original: Hañci natthi so niyamo yena niyamena sattakkhattuparamo puggalo sattakkhattuparamatāniyato, no ca vata re vattabbe—
analyzed: hañci natthi saḥ niyamaḥ yena niyamena satta kkhattu paramaḥ puggalo satta kkhattu parama tā niyataḥ no ca vata re vattabbe
translated: “Well then, you should not say that

analyzed: satta kkhattu paramaḥ puggalaḥ satta kkhattu parama tā niyato ti
translated: ‘the person who has reached the limit of seven times is limited to seven times.’
Are there no four establishments of mindfulness …

original: bojjhaṅgā yehi bojjhaṅgehi sattakkhattuparamo puggalo sattakkhattuparamatāniyatoti?
analyzed: bojjhaṅgāḥ yehi bojjhaṅgehi satta kkhattu paramaḥ puggalaḥ satta kkhattu parama tā niyato ti
translated: the seven factors of awakening according to which the person who has reached the limit of seven times is limited to seven times?”
“Yes.”

original: Hañci natthi te bojjhaṅgā yehi bojjhaṅgehi sattakkhattuparamo puggalo sattakkhattuparamatāniyato, no ca vata re vattabbe—🔽“sattakkhattuparamo puggalo sattakkhattuparamatāniyato”ti.
analyzed: hañci natthi te bojjhaṅgāḥ yehi bojjhaṅgehi satta kkhattu paramaḥ puggalaḥ satta kkhattu parama tā niyataḥ no ca vata re vattabbe  satta kkhattu paramaḥ puggalaḥ satta kkhattu parama tā niyato ti
translated: “Are there any factors of complete awakening that are not factors of complete awakening for a person who is subject to seven rebirths at most and is determined to awaken after seven rebirths at most? Or is it that you should not say whether or not he is subject to seven rebirths at most and is determined to awaken after seven rebirths at most?”

analyzed: satta kkhattu paramaḥ puggalaḥ satta kkhattu parama tā niyato ti
translated: “Is a person who is subject to seven rebirths at most determined to awaken after seven rebirths at most?”
“Yes.”
“Is he determined to be a once-returner?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is he determined to be a non-returner?”
“Is it so that the Blessed One has not declared the four noble truths?” …
“Is he determined to be fully awakened?”
“Is it so that it is not to be said that it is a person who is the same in the eye sense-sphere and in the mind-object sense-sphere?” …
“By what is he determined?”
“By stream-entry.”

analyzed: satta kkhattu paramaḥ puggalaḥ satta kkhattu parama tā niyato ti
translated: “Is a person who is subject to seven rebirths at most determined to awaken after seven rebirths at most?”
“Yes.”

original: Ye keci sotāpattiniyāmaṁ okkamanti, sabbe te sattakkhattuparamatāniyatāti?🔽Na hevaṁ vattabbe …pe….
analyzed: ye keci sotāpatti niyāmam okkamanti sabbe te satta kkhattu parama tā niyatā ati  na ha ivam vattabbe pe
translated: “Are all those who enter the fixed course of the stream determined to awaken after seven rebirths at most?”🔽“No.”
“You shouldn’t say that

analyzed: satta kkhattu paramaḥ puggalaḥ satta kkhattu parama tā niyato ti
translated: a person who is subject to seven rebirths at most is determined to awaken after seven rebirths at most.”
“Yes.”

analyzed: nanu saḥ satta kkhattu paramaḥ ti
translated: “Isn’t he subject to seven rebirths at most?”

original: Āmantā.🔽Hañci so sattakkhattuparamo, tena vata re vattabbe—🔽“sattakkhattuparamo puggalo sattakkhattuparamatāniyato”ti.
analyzed: āmantā  hañci saḥ satta kkhattu paramaḥ tena vata re vattabbe  satta kkhattu paramaḥ puggalaḥ satta kkhattu parama tā niyato ti
translated: The question.🔽“Well then, it must be said that the person who is capable of seven more rebirths is fixed at seven more rebirths.”
The discussion of the person capable of seven more rebirths is finished.
